New Records: Freddie Freeman tied the all-time series record with five home runs in five straight World Series games
Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam home run in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam home run in game one
Shohei Ohtani suffered a shoulder injury on an attempted steal
Dodger starter Walker Buehler threw 5 shutout innings in game 3
Yankee reliever Nestor Cortes gave up the winning runs in game 1
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers opened the game with a heartwarming dedication to the memory of Fernando Valenzuela
Many baseball experts offered the opinion that Valenzuela's'screwgie' was comparable to that of the great Carl Hubbell
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers are in the hero's role following the first three games of this World Series
If the Dodgers win this World Series, there will be an eternal discussion on the managing strategy of N.Y. Yankees skipper Aaron Boone in game one
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers will wear a number 34 patch with Valenzuela's first name on it throughout this World Series to honor his memory
Freddie Freeman's home run was his fifth in five straight World Series games

The Dodgers, with home runs from Tommy Edman, back-to-back home runs by Teoscar Hernandez, a two-run blast, and Freeman, rode the one-hit pitching of Yoshinobu Yamamoto, who pitched 6.1 innings and held on for a 4-2 triumph in game two
Others: The Dodgers hold a 3-0 lead over the New York Yankees in the 2024 Major League Baseball World Series
